content.description: Fun climbing up the featured, low angled face. This is the best way to approach Wisecrack.
content.protection: 8 bolts. 1 anchor shared by 5 routes; others are Mullet Stew, Wiseguy, Wisecrack, Exodus, and Cahullawusse.

content.description:
The obvious classic lightning bolt crack running up the upper 2/3 of the wall.

Start by climbing the bolted "Wiseguy" to reach the ledge below the crack splitting the upper half of the wall. Climb the crack to some chains. Climbing Wiseguy bumps the route up to about 5.9.
content.location: upper half of the Wise Up Wall. Approach via Wiseguy

content.description: The next bolted route to the left of Wiseguy. Stops at the lower anchors
content.location: middle of the Wise Up Wall (right side)

content.description: A tricky start using the arête and edges to a slightly thuggish roof. Some easier ground to a stance below a diagonal thin crack. Climb this with great protection using tcu's and excellent exposure then finish up on the short splitter to some chains.
content.location: Left side of Wise Up Wall

content.description: climb the first three bolts of Rachel and thenmove right to a super hold and a bolt. Above the break in the wall a small nut can be placed. Follow three more bolts to the top.
content.location: many variations can be done on this wall

content.description: Start on Exodus but veer left onto Cahullawassee and continue up through the roof to the Wisecrack chains. A great variation that avoids Cahullawsse’s crux start but adds the fun roof.
content.protection: Bolts and a couple cams to tame the easy run out up top (5.7) as called for Cahullawasse

content.description: To the right of Cahullawassee is this fun face climb. You can move left after the first couple bolts to join Cahullawassee for a fun 5.10 endeavor.
content.protection: 11 Bolts, a 0.4 Camalot for the top section is helpful if you do connect with Cahullawassee. All long routes on this wall share 1 anchor.

content.description: Start off the boulder to a chunky flake out left. A few strenuous moves gain the slabby arete. Climb the slab using the arete at times to a large ledge below a roof. Climb the roof and then up easier ground using a couple of cams to the Wisecrack chains.
content.location: Step off the boulder immediately into a crux then up the rib/slab that distinguishes the right from the left sides of The Wise Up Wall.

pathTokens: Hwy 20 and North Cascades National Park
